703715f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Pineapple Street
703715f-a.text:
Columbia Heights, east side, south of Pineapple Street. The Hotel Margaret named in honor of the sister of John Arbuckle, the builder, is the tallest structure in the view. The building before it on the south s ide of Orange Street, was once the Van Sinderen House. It was no longer s tanding in (1917).
About 1908.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703715f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, NY

703716f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Pineapple Street
703716f-a.text:
134-138 Columbia Heights, west side, opposite Pineapple Street, showing at the right the home of Josiah J. White. It was the only house on the Heights completely built of Brownstone, which came from a quarry owned by a
Mrs. White.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
